December 10, 2021
Goop
Cheap enhancement is always good, i think these guys are much better than the German ones. Put 3 together and they are hitting pretty hard. They're just really easy to kill is all.

May 10, 2021
tyroclix
WIN/LOSS: 1-0 Allied Soldier is exactly what you would expect - a mobile Enhancer who carries virtually no offense without his own help. EE and Quake are his bane has hitting him off of Enhancement reduces him to just a tie-up piece with no way to get him to KO. If he starts on your build it isn't bad but if you are Leadershipping them in, you can't get him off the board to try and Leadership him back in. He would have been better at 3 clicks of life and a full dial of enhancement. In 2022 it will be interesting to revisit.
April 30, 2021
Organous
This seems like it would be pretty essential for Past teams. I'd say it's also good for Soldier teams, but you still probably have a much better package from the Foot Elite. 5 points extra buys you [b]so much[/b] from those. Still, these will probably be easier to get on the secondary market than the Foot Elite, and I certainly wouldn't blame anyone for wanting a 20 point enhancer. I'd say Henchman's Goon still holds up for GCU, and this one can at least manage to fight while it's moving around.
April 26, 2021
pokolo
with the change to Perplex no longer being used on damage, these guys might prove to be the most valuable generic of this set. it's a shame there isn't an empower equivalent in this set (seriously, none of the Amazon generics got empower?)
